metadata.title: Rapid detection of viral-specific antibodies by ELISA

abstract.original_text: . Rapid detection of viral-specific antibodies by ELISA. Vet. I~unol. Immunopathol., 17: 453-464.

sentences.segment_text: Rapid detection of viral-specific antibodies by ELISA .

abstract.original_text: The development of three separate rapid ELISAs for detecting antibodies in host serum to three different viruses is described. These include:

sentences.segment_text: The development of three separate rapid ELISAs for detecting antibodies in host serum to three different viruses is described .

abstract.original_text: A direct antigen assay using enzyme labelled anti-canine Ig for detecting antibodies to canine parvovirus, 2. A competitive ELISA using a feline infectious peritonitis virus-specific monoclonal antibody labelled with enzyme, and 3. A competitive ELISA using an equine infectious anemia virus-specific monoclonal antibody and enzyme labelled antigen, p. 26.

sentences.segment_text: A direct antigen assay using enzyme labelled anti-canine Ig for detecting antibodies to canine parvovirus , 2 .
A competitive ELISA using a feline infectious peritonitis virus-specific monoclonal antibody labelled with enzyme , and 3 .
A competitive ELISA using an equine infectious anemia virus-specific monoclonal antibody and enzyme labelled antigen , p. 26 .

abstract.original_text: The utility and benefits of each of the three approaches is emphasized.

sentences.segment_text: The utility and benefits of each of the three approaches is emphasized .
